entry.name: filter
entry.title: .filter()

argument.name: selector
argument.desc: A string containing a selector expression to match the current set of elements against.

argument.name: function(index)
argument.desc: A function used as a test for each element in the set. this is the current DOM element.

argument.name: element
argument.desc: An element to match the current set of elements against.

argument.name: jQuery object
argument.desc: An existing jQuery object to match the current set of elements against.

entry.desc: Reduce the set of matched elements to those that match the selector or pass the function's test.

longdesc.p: Given a jQuery object that represents a set of DOM elements, the .filter() method constructs a new jQuery object from a subset of the matching elements. The supplied selector is tested against each element; all elements matching the selector will be included in the result.

The second form of this method allows us to filter elements against a function rather than a selector. For each element, if the function returns true (or a "truthy" value), the element will be included in the filtered set; otherwise, it will be excluded.
